unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reported a spike in gastroenteritis cases this week, mainly affecting children under 5 yrs. Dr. Sharma, Head of Gastro, mentioned the increase is likely due to the recent monsoon season.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reported a spike in gastroenteritis cases this week, mainly affecting children under five years. Doctor Sharma, Head of Gastro, mentioned the increase is likely due to the recent monsoon season.

unnormalised: "We're seeing about 30-40 cases daily now," Dr. Sharma stated. Common symptoms include vomiting, diarrhea, and dehydration. Parents are advised to ensure children drink boiled water and maintain hygiene.
normalised: "We're seeing about thirty to forty cases daily now," Doctor Sharma stated. Common symptoms include vomiting, diarrhea, and dehydration. Parents are advised to ensure children drink boiled water and maintain hygiene.

unnormalised: The hospital is also seeing cases of typhoid and hepatitis A, often waterborne diseases. The medical staff is working overtime to accommodate the increased patient load. A special helpline number, 1800-11-2233, has been set up for inquiries.
normalised: The hospital is also seeing cases of typhoid and hepatitis A, often waterborne diseases. The medical staff is working overtime to accommodate the increased patient load. A special helpline number, one eight hundred-eleven-twenty two thirty three, has been set up for inquiries.

unnormalised: "Early diagnosis is key," Dr. Khan, a senior resident, advised. "Bring your child to the nearest clinic if you notice any symptoms lasting more than 24 hrs." She also recommended ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) to combat dehydration.
normalised: "Early diagnosis is key," Doctor Khan, a senior resident, advised. "Bring your child to the nearest clinic if you notice any symptoms lasting more than twenty four hours." She also recommended O-R-S (Oral Rehydration Solution) to combat dehydration.

unnormalised: Public health officials are conducting awareness campaigns in high-risk areas like JJ colonies and slums. The campaign aims to educate people on proper sanitation practices and the importance of safe drinking water to prevent further spread.
normalised: Public health officials are conducting awareness campaigns in high-risk areas like J-J colonies and slums. The campaign aims to educate people on proper sanitation practices and the importance of safe drinking water to prevent further spread.
